intro: Anguina nervifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed anguina, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, clustered in inflorescences. Its botanical classification places it in the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. Anguina nervifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
